# BJ's Wholesale Club Holdings, Inc. (BJ) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

BJ's Wholesale Club Holdings, Inc., together with its subsidiaries, operates membership warehouse clubs on the eastern half of the United States. The company offers groceries, fresh food, general merchandise, gasoline and other ancillary services, coupon books, and promotions. It sells its products through its clubs; the BJs.com website; and its mobile app. BJ's is a leading operator of membership warehouse clubs focused on delivering significant value to its members and serving a shared purpose: "We take care of the families who depend on us." The company offers up to 25% savings on a representative basket of manufacturer-branded groceries compared to traditional supermarket competitors. BJ's provides a wide assortment of fresh foods, produce, a full-service deli, fresh bakery, household essentials and gas. In addition, BJ's offers the latest technology, home decor, small appliances, apparel, seasonal items and more. Headquartered in Marlborough, Massachusetts, the company pioneered the warehouse club model in New England in 1984 and has grown its footprint to large-format, high volume warehouse clubs spanning 21 states. In its core New England market, the company operates more than three times the number of clubs compared to the next largest warehouse club competitor.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of BJ is 97.54 USD — it has increased by 2.69% in the past 24 hours. BJ's Wholesale Club Holdings's market cap is $12.36B. The company has 33 K employees and operates 257 locations as of Q3 2025.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

BJ's product categories include grocery, household and pet, television and electronics, furniture, computer and tablets, patio and outdoor living, lawn and garden, baby and kids, toys, home, health and beauty, appliances, and jewelry. The company also minimizes distribution complexity and enhances its procurement scale on select items by offering a limited assortment of just 7,000 stock-keeping units (or SKUs) per store, and offers a limited assortment of 7,000 stock-keeping units at its warehouses to achieve greater procurement scale on select items. About 80% of BJ's net sales come from grocery items and general merchandise, with the remaining 20% stemming from gasoline and other ancillary services.

BJ's private label brands include Wellsley Farms and Berkley Jensen brands, which offer national brand quality for noticeably less. Private labels have been a key growth driver for BJ's, with its in-house brands Wellsley Farms and Berkley Jensen now accounting for over 25% of the company's business.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### New Store Expansion
Plans call for between 25 and 30 new clubs over the next two years, which includes the company's entry into the Dallas-Fort Worth market in 2026. BJ's Wholesale Club is planning to open nine new U.S. stores in 2026, and already debuted a new location on December 17 in Casselberry, Florida—its third in December alone, following openings in Springfield, Massachusetts, and Sumter, South Carolina.

### New Format Development
The location in Delray Beach will be a BJ's market – the second of the company's concept clubs. BJ's market provides a convenient, expedited grocery shopping experience that will feature top-selling fresh foods, produce, sundries and seasonal products for members, with all the value and convenience that BJ's members have come to know and love from the club.

### Infrastructure Investment
BJ's is constructing a new distribution center in Commercial Point, Ohio, which is set to open in 2027.

## 5. Growth Strategy

### Geographic Expansion
BJ's will debut in Texas, with multiple clubs and gas stations planned for the Dallas-Fort Worth area in early 2026. BJ's Wholesale Club views Texas as an ideal market for expansion. According to the company, each new BJ's location is anticipated to generate 100 to 150 jobs in its local community.

### Digital Innovation
Through a partnership with Roadie, a UPS company, BJ's recently expanded same-day delivery for larger items like patio sets and electronics. In 2023, the company transitioned its omnichannel inventory operations to a microservices-based order management system (OMS) through a partnership with Nextuple. The new system enables BJ's to optimize fulfillment across various channels—whether in-store, curbside, or through same-day delivery—allowing for more flexibility and faster service.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

BJ's operates a membership-based model serving individual consumers and families. The company achieved a milestone of 8 million members as of Q2 2025. BJ's also serves public sector organizations through OMNIA Partners, consistently offering 25% or more savings on a representative basket of manufacturer-branded groceries compared to traditional supermarket competitors. At BJ's Wholesale, they take immense pride in curating a comprehensive assortment of national and private label products for all organization's needs.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Q3 2025 Results
BJ's Wholesale Club Q3 2025 revenue reached $5.35B, net income was $152.1M, diluted EPS $1.15, with membership fee income up 9.8% and 1.1% comparable club sales growth. The company's non-GAAP profit was $1.16 per share, which beat analysts' consensus estimates of $1.09 per share by 6.6%. Adjusted EBITDA came in at $301.4 million, beating estimates of $294.5 million and representing a 5.6% margin.

### Annual Performance
In 2024, BJ's revenue was $20.50 billion, an increase of 2.67% compared to the previous year's $19.97 billion. Earnings were $534.42 million, an increase of 2.04%. BJ's has demonstrated strong financial performance since 2018, with net sales up 58%, membership fee income up 61%, and adjusted EBITDA up 92%. Most impressively, adjusted EPS has grown 205% over this period, while the company has generated $2.7 billion in cumulative adjusted free cash flow.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Tailwinds
- The U.S. warehouse club market has expanded from $108 billion in 2007 to $298 billion in 2024, representing a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 6%.
- BJ's has outperformed the broader retail sector with a 9% CAGR from 2019-2024, compared to 7% for grocery, 5% for total retail, and 4% for general merchandise retailers.
- Digitally enabled comparable sales growth was 30%, reflecting two-year stacked comp growth of 61%

### Headwinds
- The stock decline reflects the near-term impact of a choppy consumer backdrop and challenging competition.
- BJ faces potential merchandise margin pressure due to price investments to offset tariff impacts in the second half.
- Further expansion from Costco into East Coast markets poses a threat to BJ's long-term relevance, as it lacks the behemoth's vast scale and enviable brand image.

## 9. Market Shares

As of August 2022, Costco holds the largest share of the wholesale club market, 55.5%. Sam's followed that, 36.2%, and BJ's came in far behind, 8.3%, according to the career data site Zippia. Despite the smaller market share, BJ's Wholesale is currently concentrated on the East Coast (roughly 20% of BJ's annual sales are in the New York metro area) but slowly expanding towards the Midwest.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

### Store Count and Revenue
Sam's sales totaled $73.6 billon in its fiscal year 2022 and BJ's sales totaled $16.3 billion in fiscal year 2021. In Costco's fiscal year 2022, sales totaled $222.7 billion with a comparable sales increase of 16% year-over-year.

### Product Assortment
Costco actually carries far fewer items than its competitors, offering about 4,000 SKUs (stock keeping units—aka items). Meanwhile, BJ's states that it offers more than 7,000 SKUs.

### Membership Pricing
Costco is the priciest at $65, but like BJ's, you do get a second member card for free. Sam's Club's Savings Membership goes for just $50, the most affordable option of the bunch.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Strategic Partnerships
- Partnership with Roadie, a UPS company, for same-day delivery expansion
- Partnership with Nextuple for order management system modernization
- 15-year partnership with Feeding America, which has provided over 155 million meals to date

### Historical Ownership Changes
In 2011, BJ's was acquired by two private equity firms, Leonard Green & Partners and CVC Capital Partners. It returned to being a public company in 2018.

## 12. Recent Developments

### Membership Growth and Fee Increases
Membership fee revenue rose 9.8% year over year to about $126.3 million in Q3. A membership fee increase that took effect in January 2025.

### New Store Openings in 2025
In 2025, the membership-based warehouse chain added 12 new locations in a number of states, including Georgia, Kentucky, New Jersey, Massachusetts, New York, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Tennessee.

### Community Investment
BJ's Wholesale Club (NYSE: BJ) has announced a $1.25 million donation to combat hunger, with initial grants focused in Massachusetts. The donation, made through BJ's Charitable Foundation, will support various food banks and pantries across their operational footprint. In Massachusetts, the Franklin Food Pantry will receive funds for a new refrigerated truck and cooling units to serve their growing client base, which saw a 38% increase in demand from 2023 to 2024.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

Based on the comprehensive analysis of BJ's Wholesale Club's financial performance, growth strategy, market position, and competitive advantages:

**Strengths:**
- Strong membership growth reaching 8 million members
- Robust digital growth with 30% increase in digitally enabled sales
- Aggressive expansion plans with 25-30 new stores over next two fiscal years
- Dominant position in East Coast markets with 3x more clubs than nearest competitor
- Strong financial performance with consistent earnings growth
- Effective cost management and operational efficiency

**Challenges:**
- Small market share (8.3%) compared to Costco (55.5%) and Sam's Club (36.2%)
- Limited geographic presence compared to national competitors
- Potential margin pressure from competitive investments
- Consumer spending headwinds and inflation concerns

**Investment Rating: 6.8/10**

This rating reflects a solid "Buy" recommendation for growth-oriented portfolios with moderate risk tolerance. The company demonstrates strong operational execution, strategic expansion opportunities, and defensive characteristics through its membership model.

**Estimated Fair Value: $115-120**

Based on current fundamentals, growth prospects, and peer valuations, the fair value range represents approximately 18-23% upside from current levels around $97.54. The valuation considers BJ's strong regional market position, accelerating digital growth, expansion opportunities, and the premium typically accorded to membership-based retail models. The target reflects expectations for continued membership growth, margin expansion through scale, and successful geographic expansion into high-growth markets like Texas.
tldr_summary:
BJ's Wholesale Club is a membership-based warehouse retailer operating primarily in the eastern United States, offering groceries, merchandise, and services across 257 locations. The company is aggressively expanding, planning 25-30 new clubs in the next two years, including its first entry into the Texas market, while growing its digital capabilities through partnerships like same-day delivery with Roadie and modernizing its order management systems. Despite holding only 8.3% market share compared to Costco's 55.5%, BJ's has demonstrated strong financial performance with 58% net sales growth since 2018, 8 million members, and consistent earnings increases. Key strengths include its dominant East Coast presence, robust private label offerings (25% of business), and strategic focus on geographic and digital expansion. The company's membership model provides resilience and steady revenue growth, with continued investments in infrastructure and community engagement.

The AI rates BJ's as a solid "Buy" with a fair value of $115-120, representing 18-23% upside potential based on strong operational execution and growth prospects.
